articles.title: Kim Jong Il Greets State Leaders of Various Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Greets State Leaders of Various Countries 
    Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il sent messages of greetings to state leaders of various countries on the occasion of the New Year, Juche 93 (2004).
 Among them were Amir of Kuwaiti State Jaber Al-Ahmed Al-Jaber Al-Sabah, King of the Kingdom of Thailand Bhumibol Adulyadej, King of the Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan Abdullah the Second, President and Supreme Commander of Armed Forces of Nigeria Olusegun Obasanjo, King of Morocco Mohamed the Sixth, President and Head of State of Mali Amadou Toumani Toure, President of the Republic of Sudan Omar Hassan Ahmed Al-Bashir, President of the Republic of Djibouti Ismail Omar Guelleh, President of the Republic of Congo Denis Sassou Nguesso, President of the Arab Republic of Egypt Mohamed Hosni Mubarak, Malaysian Prime Minister Datuk Sri Abdullah Ahmad Badawi and Prime Minister of Saint Vincent and Grenadines Ralph Gonsalves.    
 Kim Jong Il in the messages extended warm greetings to them on the occasion of the New Year and wished them successes in their work for the development of the countries, expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and those countries would grow stronger.

Special Homepage for Celebrating February 16 Opened in Spain
articles.content:
Special Homepage for Celebrating February 16 Opened in Spain 
    Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The Spanish Association for Friendship with the Korean People opened a special Internet homepage on January 22 to celebrate February 16, birthday of leader Kim Jong Il.
 Edited in the homepage was a portrait of Kim Jong Il with letters "Long live the Supreme Commander!" and "2.16, 1942-2.16, 2004" and Korean film picture-accompanied music.

Prep. Committee Formed in Spain
articles.content:
Prep. Committee Formed in Spain 
    Pyongyang, January 31 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee of the Association for Friendship with the Korean People in Spain was inaugurated with due ceremony on Jan. 19 to celebrate the birthday of leader Kim Jong Il, the Sun of the 21st Century.
 The ceremony elected Alejandro Cao de Benos, chairman of the association, chairman of the preparatory committee.    
 The committee discussed issues of conducting diverse activities from February to April to praise the wise leadership and immortal exploits of President Kim Il Sung and leader  Kim Jong Il and widely introduce the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, guided by the Juche Idea.

Prep. Committee Inaugurated in Poland
articles.content:
Prep. Committee Inaugurated in Poland
    Pyongyang, January 31 (KCNA) -- An inaugural ceremony of a preparatory committee was held in Warsaw on Jan. 20 under the sponsorship of the Central Committee of the Poland-Korea Association to commemorate the 10th anniversary of the demise of the great President Kim Il Sung and celebrate national holidays of the Korean people.
 Tadeusz Bialkowski, First Vice-Chairman of the Central Committee of the Poland-Korea Association, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee at the ceremony.    
 The committee discussed the issues of holding colorful functions to widely introduce the immortal exploits of the President and leader Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the 10th anniversary of the demise of Kim Il Sung, the Day of the Sun, February 16, (birthday of Kim Jong Il), the 40th anniversary of his start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.

WPK Praised by Mexican Figure
articles.content:
WPK Praised by Mexican Figure
    Pyongyang, January 31 (KCNA) -- Rafael Aguilar Talamantes, chairman of the Socialist Party of Mexico, praised the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) at the closing ceremony of the Second Congress of the party held on January 25.
 The chairman noted that the WPK, guided by the Juche idea, has waged a vigorous struggle to build a great prosperous powerful socialist nation and reunify the country while smashing the U.S. moves to isolate and stifle it.    
 Saying that the WPK remains strong as it has the Juche idea, he stressed that his party should apply the idea to working out its strategy and tactics.

Prep. Comm. for Citizens' Solidarity in 2004 Gen.Election Holds Press Conference
articles.content:
Prep. Comm. for Citizens' Solidarity in 2004 Gen.Election Holds Press Conference
    Pyongyang, January 31 (KCNA) -- The Preparatory Committee for Citizens' Solidarity in 2004 General Election held a press conference on January 27 and decided to conduct a defeating campaign in application and election, according to south Korean KBS.
 It set irregularities and corruption, violation of election law and human rights abuses as a standard of defeat in election with the approach of the general election and declared that it would conduct a campaign for defeating National Assembly members according to it.    
 It said that to this end it would inaugurate the Citizens' Solidarity in 2004 General Election involving civic and public organizations across south Korea on February 3 and open to the public the first list of those to be defeated among incumbent members of the National Assembly to conduct a defeating campaign.

U.S. Accused of Impeding Peace, Reunification and Cooperation of Korean Nation
articles.content:
U.S. Accused of Impeding Peace, Reunification and Cooperation of Korean Nation
    Pyongyang, January 31 (KCNA) -- The United States is a wicked disturber of peace and reunification of Korea and national cooperation as it is keen to bedevil the favorably developing inter-Korean relations and bar the implementation of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration by driving the situation on the Korean peninsula to an extreme pitch of tension, says Rodong Sinmun today in a signed article.
 The article recalls facts that the U.S. hatched a plot to perpetuate the division of Korea into two parts and instigated the south Korean separatist forces for its realization in the 1970s.    
 It goes on: Early in the 1990s, a series of high-level talks took place between the north and the south and an "agreement on reconciliation, non-aggression and cooperation and exchange between the north and the south" and "joint declaration on denuclearization of the Korean peninsula" were adopted at the talks. The United States, however, has left no means untried to hamper the process of reconciliation and cooperation between the north and the south and that of peace on the Korean peninsula. The U.S. imperialists fabricated the "nuclear suspicion" of north Korea and kicked up a frantic anti-DPRK campaign. The U.S. instigated some elements of the International Atomic Energy Agency to threaten the DPRK with "special inspection". It brought up the "nuclear issue" on the Korean peninsula for discussion at the U.N. and had an unjust resolution on applying sanctions against the DPRK adopted there. This resulted in totally freezing the hard-won north-south dialogue which had produced some results and blocking the implementation of the north-south agreement and the joint declaration on denuclearization.  The U.S. is kicking up a nuclear racket again and persisting in its moves against the DPRK and reunification though the Koreans are striving hard to glorify the era of independent reunification ushered in by the adoption of the historic June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
